Initial Rails 4 app
Add Ion.Sound lib and game sounds on move and merge
Add method to update game status: won or lost
Add method to update game score on the page

Add keydown listener to move the game

The keydown listener to process left, up, right, down keys and
reset the game tiles. The reset function fetches all children
of the tile-container and removes them one by one.

Finally, the tiles are rendered again.

Render tiles on the plane

Add tile rendering that iterates over game board and adds
divs with corresponding classes to the tile-container.
Add page styles and background
Add game score
Add styles for tile values
Create tile overlay with positions
Add initial board layout in HTML/CSS
Do not allow to move if game is finished

Add method to check whether game is lost

The game is lost when there are no empty spots and no more moves left
Win the game when score reaches 2048 and add win method

Keep track of the game score

When tiles are merged, add the resulting tile value to the score.

Add move method that executes to a given direction

Add a public move method and use it to move the board.
If board has changed during the move, generate a new tile.

Make the respective move methods private.
Add moveDown method using matrix transpose and moveRight
Add moveUp method using matrix transpose and moveLeft
Add moveRight method that moves tiles to the right and merges

Add moveLeft method that moves tiles to the left and merges

This method goes through each row and shifts each value to the left.
If two adjacent values (from left to right) are equal, they're merged.
Finally, it updates the board and returns whether board has changed.
Add method to render board in the console

Add tile generation and start with two of them

The tile generation method randomly picks either 2 or 4, where
2 has 80% chance to appear and 4 only 20%. Then the method tries
to find an empty slot on the board and if it exists, adds the generated
tile to the board.

On game initialization, we generate two tiles.

Add method to get available position on the board

To start off, we'd need to randomly place two tiles on the board.
However, we don't know which slots on the board are available.
Hence, this method finds an empty slot on the board.

If its found, it will return its coordinates.
If not (board is full), it will return false.

Game initialization and default structure

- Create a Game class to hold the game state
- Initialize the Game when window is loaded
- Store the board state in a 2-dimensional array
- Keep track of score, and whether the game was lost or won

Unit Testing IsbnValidator:

ruby -Itest test/unit/isbn_validator_test.rb
ruby -Itest test/unit/some_other_test.rb -n test_name
rake test
rake test:units

ISBN Validator Class
* Add lib to autoload path by adding the following line to config/application.rb:
config.autoload_paths = %W(#{config.root}/lib)
* Add a class called IsbnValidator to lib. The class initializes with an isbn string
and has a method "valid?", which returns true or false depending on whether isbn is valid.

First Feature - Index page:

* First remove the public/index.html page, which is the default static page in new Rails applications
rm public/index.html
* Then generate a site controller with one action called index:
rails g controller site index
* Edit the app/views/site/index.html.erb to add some content.
* Finally, edit routes.rb and add a root route which points to our new controller and action.
root :to => "site#index"
Update README #ignore

Deploying with Heroku:

* Add Gems required by Heroku so that your Gemfile has these lines

gem 'heroku'
gem 'execjs'
gem 'therubyracer'

group :production do
  gem 'pg'
end

group :development do
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

* Configure Heroku production environment to compile assets by
Open config/production.rb and set compile to true
config.assets.compile = true

* Install Gems and commit to repository
bundle install
git add .
git commit -a
git push

* Configure Heroku for this application, enter Heroku credentials if prompted
heroku create
* Heroku will configure Git remote to point to created server
* To automatically deploy this application to Internet
git push heroku master

Setting up:

* Install Bundler - Application dependency manager
gem install bundler
* Install Rails
gem install rails
* Create a new Rails application
rails new library
* Start the server
rails server
* Hello, Rails! Open the browser at
http://localhost:3000
Point client_key to client.pem in home directory

ruby -Itest test/unit/isbn_validator_test.rb
ruby -Itest test/unit/some_other_test.rb -n test_name
rake test
rake test:units

First Feature - Index page:

* First remove the public/index.html page, which is the default static page in new Rails applications
rm public/index.html
* Then generate a site controller with one action called index:
rails g controller site index
* Edit the app/views/site/index.html.erb to add some content.
* Finally, edit routes.rb and add a root route which points to our new controller and action.
root :to => "site#index"

Deploying with Heroku:

* Add Gems required by Heroku so that your Gemfile has these lines

gem 'heroku'
gem 'execjs'
gem 'therubyracer'

group :production do
  gem 'pg'
end

group :development do
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

* Configure Heroku production environment to compile assets by
Open config/production.rb and set compile to true
config.assets.compile = true

* Install Gems and commit to repository
bundle install
git add .
git commit -a
git push

* Configure Heroku for this application, enter Heroku credentials if prompted
heroku create
* Heroku will configure Git remote to point to created server
* To automatically deploy this application to Internet
git push heroku master
Demo app to show client side validation gem issue

Unit Testing IsbnValidator:

ruby -Itest test/unit/isbn_validator_test.rb
ruby -Itest test/unit/some_other_test.rb -n test_name
rake test
rake test:units

ISBN Validator Class
* Add lib to autoload path by adding the following line to config/application.rb:
config.autoload_paths = %W(#{config.root}/lib)
* Add a class called IsbnValidator to lib. The class initializes with an isbn string
and has a method "valid?", which returns true or false depending on whether isbn is valid.

First Feature - Index page:

* First remove the public/index.html page, which is the default static page in new Rails applications
rm public/index.html
* Then generate a site controller with one action called index:
rails g controller site index
* Edit the app/views/site/index.html.erb to add some content.
* Finally, edit routes.rb and add a root route which points to our new controller and action.
root :to => "site#index"
Update README #ignore

Deploying with Heroku:

* Add Gems required by Heroku so that your Gemfile has these lines

gem 'heroku'
gem 'execjs'
gem 'therubyracer'

group :production do
  gem 'pg'
end

group :development do
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

* Configure Heroku production environment to compile assets by
Open config/production.rb and set compile to true
config.assets.compile = true

* Install Gems and commit to repository
bundle install
git add .
git commit -a
git push

* Configure Heroku for this application, enter Heroku credentials if prompted
heroku create
* Heroku will configure Git remote to point to created server
* To automatically deploy this application to Internet
git push heroku master

Setting up:

* Install Bundler - Application dependency manager
gem install bundler
* Install Rails
gem install rails
* Create a new Rails application
rails new library
* Start the server
rails server
* Hello, Rails! Open the browser at
http://localhost:3000

commit_list.message:
First Feature - Index page:

* First remove the public/index.html page, which is the default static page in new Rails applications
rm public/index.html
* Then generate a site controller with one action called index:
rails g controller site index
* Edit the app/views/site/index.html.erb to add some content.
* Finally, edit routes.rb and add a root route which points to our new controller and action.
root :to => "site#index"
commit_list.repo_description: Library app as part of Eficode Academy Rails course

commit_list.message: Update README #ignore
commit_list.repo_description: Library app as part of Eficode Academy Rails course

commit_list.message:
Deploying with Heroku:

* Add Gems required by Heroku so that your Gemfile has these lines

gem 'heroku'
gem 'execjs'
gem 'therubyracer'

group :production do
  gem 'pg'
end

group :development do
  gem 'sqlite3'
end

* Configure Heroku production environment to compile assets by
Open config/production.rb and set compile to true
config.assets.compile = true

* Install Gems and commit to repository
bundle install
git add .
git commit -a
git push

* Configure Heroku for this application, enter Heroku credentials if prompted
heroku create
* Heroku will configure Git remote to point to created server
* To automatically deploy this application to Internet
git push heroku master
commit_list.repo_description: Library app as part of Eficode Academy Rails course

commit_list.message:
Setting up:

* Install Bundler - Application dependency manager
gem install bundler
* Install Rails
gem install rails
* Create a new Rails application
rails new library
* Start the server
rails server
* Hello, Rails! Open the browser at
http://localhost:3000
